intro: Melhania ambovombeensis, commonly known as the Ambovombe starfruit, is a rare and endemic species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits, which are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
